page.title: 08Hambleden Church.
page.content: The village church is the oldest village building with registers dating back to 1566.The oldest part of the existing church is the North Transept, some of which was built in the twelth century.In 1985,the members of the Parochial Church Council decided to re- decorate the interior which was last done in 1968.The quotation for the work was 11,172 pounds + V.A.T.Work commenced on 15th.April and was completed on 20th.June.The lime-wash which was applied did not adhere to the existing surface and the walls had to be scraped at an extra cost of 1150 pounds.Dry rot was discovered in the North Transept and Rentokil repaired the damage.This cost 4004 pounds.The altar frontal chest was also infected and will be replaced at a cost of 1000 pounds.
